Jan Algermissen wrote:
> 
> Roy pretty much says it all there - why, oh, why won't this thread
> come to a halt?
> 

What, specifically, do you think Roy is saying that makes it OK to use
opaque identifiers on the Web and call it self-descriptive?  Do you
mean this?

"The problem is that I can't say 'REST requires media types to be
registered' because both Internet media types and the registry
controlled by IANA are a specific architecture's instance of the style."

This says nothing to refute my assertion that the specific instance of
REST known as the Web _does_ require media types to be IANA-registered.
Yeah, it might get replaced someday, but that day is nowhere on the
horizon, so at the present time, on the Web, it absolutely goes against
self-descriptive messaging to do what HTTP "discourages" by passing
opaque identifiers.

-Eric
